mdRecord.dcterms:creator: La Motte
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Refers to applications from French merchants requesting American colors for their ships; rejects offers on the principle that ships flying American colors must be built in America and that America is the only neutral nation one can trust; suggest that American ships be allowed to carry French goods from French colonies to France; otherwise goods would have to go through America first and be subject to such heavy duties as to defeat the benefit.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Merchant marine
France--Colonies
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Extract of Delamotte, n.p. to Gaspard Monge, enclosed in Letter, 1793 February 9, to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
